I found that there are two forms added in header of website but they were hidden and were not in used. So it is inlcuding the recaptcha files, you can also check this at your end, else there is no reason of this.
Anyone got any solution to put restriction/limit on inventory and quantity in HubSpot payments?
Thanks all, I looked into this and I have Sales Hub Pro, which prevents me from using these workflows action.

What would the Custom Code look like? This approach could work as we are already using custom code actions
I don't know off the top of my head. Would need to dig into past work

*HubSpot CMS GraphQL Question*

Hi,

I am populating a list using a GraphQL query and the response is not returning an offset.
The <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/query-HubSpot-data-using-graphql#query-argument-types:~:text=The%20index%20from%20where%20to%20start%20fetching%20items.%20The%20default%20is%200.%20When%20paginating%20results%2C%20the%20next%20offset%20is%20returned%20in%20the%20response.|Docs> say:
_“The index from where to start fetching items. The default is 0. When paginating results, the next offset is returned in the response.“_

There is no mention of offset when I print the entire module response({{module|pprint }}

Is this a bug or am I missing something?

See entire response:
`(SizeLimitingPyMap: {event_name=*, data_query_variables={}, type=module, data_query={extensions={query_complexity={max_points=30000, used_points=411, points_for_internal_api_requests={count=1, weight=300, used_points=300}, points_for_objects_retrieved={count=3, weight=30, used_points=90}, points_for_properties_with_value={count=6, weight=3, used_points=18}, points_for_properties_without_value={count=3, weight=1, used_points=3}}}, data={CRM={p_event_activities_collection={items=[{contact_email=<mailto:bob@peritidigital.com|bob@peritidigital.com>, contact_first_name=Bob, contact_last_name=Harney}, {contact_email=<mailto:derek@peritidigital.com|derek@peritidigital.com>, contact_first_name=Derek, contact_last_name=Harney}, {contact_email=null, contact_first_name=null, contact_last_name=null}]}}}}})`

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

Hey !

I would like to use SSO for private content inside a knowledge base.
But i don’t understand how HubSpot can match HubSpot Contacts and the data from our system ?

For example if a lead submit a form on HubSpot, then he create an account on our system ( so we generate a sso token )
He can now access to private content on HubSpot right ?

But how HubSpot do the match between both systems ?
Via Email ?
Sorry i’m a bit confused :slightly_smiling_face:

In a current theme, this would most likely be handled with the core Rich Text module where you can view the source and drop in whatever HTML is needed.

At the end of the day, the solution would depend on exactly what you are needing to do. But that framework you're in is certainly outdated. You won't find any current HubSpot CMS elements that work within that.
Hello. I got one more Inbound Ticket if someone is interested. :partying_face:

Hi everyone, I’m trying to enable oauth via HubSpot, but I keep getting the following error message upon oauth sign in even though all the scopes are added in my app via my developer account:
```Couldn't complete the connection
This account doesn't have access to some HubSpot features that are required by this app. Please contact the app developer.```
It seems to all work fine in dev (where I’m running the test account), but when I try it in production, it doesn’t seem to work. I read the community posts regarding this, but I can’t seem to solve it. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

1: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/set-up-single-sign-on-sso-to-access-private-content#require-sso-for-specific-knowledge-base-articles|Enable SSO for certain knowledge base articles>.
2: Customer visits knowledge base article page (e.g. your_kb_subdomain/kb_protected_page1)
3: HubSpot recognizes they are not authenticated
4: HubSpot sends them to the "Remote Login URL" you have configured in your SSO settings on HubSpot.
5: In your case I assume the "Remote Login URL" is from "your system" where Users can Register/Login.
6: "Your system" completes the necessary identity verification for the Customer and redirects them to (your_kb_subdomain/_hcms/mem/jwt?=<jwt verifiable with a secret configured in HubSpot's SSO settings>&redirect_url=<the original url the customer was trying to visit>)
7: The JWT will contain the email property which HubSpot will use to recognize the Customer and send them to the Original URL as an authenticated Contact.
The above steps assume you would be using SSO with JWT. There is also the SAML option if you would prefer that.

Hi, everyone, we are currently trying to connect a domain to a new portal. For context it's connected to an existing portal and wanted to repoint it to their new one.

Since they need it ASAP and naturally the process with getting this through their IT will take a long time.

I wanted to ask if there is a way to connect the domain to the new domain without updating the DNS records?

Would really appreciate the help!
Thanks <@U058ZPH175H> !
So it’s possible to display a contact property on a page protected by sso ? ( firstname, lastname for example )

7: The JWT will contain the email property which HubSpot will use to recognize the Customer and send them to the Original URL as an authenticated Contact.

Yes so its based on email, can i change that ?

Yes. It is based on Email. Without email in the JWT token you would get <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/set-up-single-sign-on-sso-to-access-private-content#set-up-sso-for-a-jwt-based-application:~:text=MISSING_EMAIL_IN_TOKEN|MISSING_EMAIL_IN_TOKEN> error. So it cannot be changed.
